src:
Srpske košarkašice počinju novi ciklus, Marina Maljković očekuje punu halu
04 Nov 2019, 15:23 by Zile
Ženska košarkaška reprezentacija Srbije počinje novi ciklus kvalifikacija za Evropsko prvenstvo 2021. godine.
Prvi rival, 14. novembra od 17 časova u hali „Ranko Žeravica“ biće selekcija Turske.
– Počinje novi ciklus i očekujem da dobijemo neka nova imena za žensku košarku. Veliki je broj novih, mladih igračica, koje su pozvane za ovaj „prozor“ i, kao i uvek, traži se način više da se radi, da se upoznamo sa čime sve Srbija može da raspolaže, tako da smo uveli i ovaj vikend pre zvaničnog okupljanja reprezentacije u ponedeljak 11. novembra. Tog 9. i 10. novembra ćemo imati četiri ili pet treninga sa najmlađim igračicama, da ih testiramo i vidimo koliko brzo one mogu da se priključe seniorkama i isprate sve to. Vodeće igračice, koje su osvojile bronzanu medalju na EP, će raditi po posebnom režimu. Očekujem da one poput Aleksandre Crvendakić i mlađih na pravi način iznesu tešku utakmicu protiv Turske i pokažu da su spremne za to. Nećemo moći da računamo na Draganu Stanković iz Galatasaraja koja je povređena. Međutim pozitivno što je klub dozvolio da se oporavlja u Srbiji kod naših lekara i biće uskoro dobro, ali će sigurno propustiti meč protiv Turske, izjavila je Marina Maljković, selektor srpskih košarkašica.
Turska je rival za respekt.
– Tri pripremne utakmice koje smo letos igrali sa Turskom sigurno ne mogu da se porede sa zvaničnim mečevima. Još nisu objavili spisak, ali očekujemo da neće biti puno promena. Imamo samo tri dana da se spremimo za tu utakmicu, što nikada nije bilo, uvek smo imali po šest-sedam treninga u prethodnim „prozorima“. Većina turskih reprezentativki je u Fenerbahčeu, Galatasaraju i Hataju, igraju dobro, ali i naše igraju dobro, zbog čega sam zadovoljna… Sama pomisao na Olimpijske igre našim devojkama je dovoljan motiv, samo treba naporno da radimo i pripremimo se za kvalifikacioni turnir u februaru… Daj Bože da dobijemo domaćinstvo… Dakle, to je neki ciklus koji se manje-više zatvara za neke naše igračice koje su bile nosioci igre kada smo poslednjih godina osvajali medalje na velikim takmičenjima, a nove igračice treba da se pokažu u ovim kvalifikacijama. Najvažnije je da smo uživali prošlog leta kada smo osvajali bronzanu medalju, pokazali smo da umemo da se nosimo sa pritiskom i volimo da igramo pred našom publikom. Ljudi koji su bili u „Štark Areni“ su svedoci toga i mnogo su nam pomogli da osvojimo bronzu koja je za nas toliko posebna. Snaga te medalje je i dalje izuzetno važna, imali smo prelep ambijent za žensku košarku. Očekujemo da hram novobeogradske košarke „Hala sportova Ranko Žeravica“ bude puna i da pokušamo da sa novim mladim snagama pobedimo Tursku, što neće biti nimalo lako. Obećavamo da ćemo ostaviti poslednji atom snage na terenu, u našem dobro poznatom maniru, da bismo ostvarili pobedu, poručila je Maljkovićeva.
Jedna od najboljih srpskih košarkašica, Sonja Petrović, oporavlja se od povrede, ali će biti uz ekipu protiv Turske.
– Kao što je selektorka napomenula, mislim da smo na Evropskom prvenstvu maletene već započeli ovaj novi ciklus, jer je data prilika nekim mladim devojkama da budu pored nas starijih. što nam je dalo neku novu energiju tokom celog EP. Drago mi je da ću biti uz ekipu i tokom ovog „prozora“ iako neću moći da igram jer sam u fazi oporavka. Potrudiću se da što više budem uz devojke, jer od ovoga krećemo za ono što je najbitnije, a to je kvalifikacioni turnir za Olimpijske igre u februaru. Nadam se da ćemo dobiti domaćinstvo… Mlade igračice treba da stasavaju uz nas. Svi smo svesni da će ova generacija uskoro možda završiti svoju priču i želimo da to bude na pravi način – Olimpijskim igrama i eventualnim rezultatom u Tokiju. Ali, rezultati nisu sve, gledamo svoju zaostavštinu, šta će ostati posle nas. Iako je ova utakmica sa Turskom najbitnija u kvalifikacijama za EP, to će biti prilika da upoznamo neka nova lica, da vide kako kod nas funkcionišu stvari, izjavila je Petrovićeva.
Na širem spisku nalaze se Jelena Bruks, Aleksandra Stanaćev, Maja Škorić, Jovana Nogić, Maja Miljković, Aleksandra Crvendakić, Nevena Jovanović, Ana Dabović, Nikolina Milić, Saša Čađo, Miljana Bojović, Teodora Turudić, Snežana Bogićević, Tina Krajišnik (Jovanović), Dajana Butulija, Ivana Katanić, Sofija Olić, Aleksandra Mužević, Maša Janković, Nadežda Nedeljkov, Milica Bojović i Miona Zarić.

POVEZANE OBJAVE
text:
Serbian basketball players begin a new cycle, Marina Maljkovic expects a full hall
04 Nov 2019, 15:23 by Zile
Serbia's women's basketball team begins a new cycle of qualifying for the 2021 European Championships.
The first rival, on November 14, from 5pm in the Ranko Zeravica Hall will be the selection of Turkey.
- A new cycle is beginning and I expect to get some new names for women's basketball. There are a large number of new, young players who have been invited to this "window" and, as always, are looking for a way to do more, to get acquainted with everything Serbia can have, so we introduced this weekend before the official national team reunions on Monday 11 November. On November 9th and 10th we will have four or five training sessions with the youngest players, to test them and see how quickly they can join the seniors and wash it all off. The leading players, who won a bronze medal at the EP, will operate under a special regime. I expect those like Aleksandra Crvendakic and the younger ones to make the tough match against Turkey and show that they are ready for it. We will not be able to count on Dragan Stankovic from Galatasaraj who was injured. However, positive that the club allowed to recover in Serbia with our doctors and it will be good soon, but it will surely miss the match against Turkey, said Marina Maljkovic, selector of Serbian basketball players.
Turkey is a rival for respect.
- The three preparatory games we played with Turkey this year certainly cannot be compared to official matches. They haven't released the list yet, but we expect there won't be much change. We only have three days to prepare for the game, which never was, we always had six to seven training sessions in the previous "windows". Most of the Turkish national teams are in Fenerbahce, Galatasaray and Hatay, playing well, but ours playing well, which is why I am pleased… The thought of the Olympics is enough for our girls, we just need to work hard and prepare for the qualifying tournament in February… God forbid we get a household ... So it's a cycle that more or less closes for some of our players who have been winners of the game when we won medals in big competitions in recent years, and new players need to show up in these qualifications. Most importantly, we enjoyed last summer winning a bronze medal, showing that we can handle the pressure and love to play in front of our audience. The people at Stark Arena have witnessed this and they have helped us a lot to win the bronze that is so special to us. The strength of that medal is still extremely important, we had a beautiful setting for women's basketball. We expect the Temple of Ranko Zeravica's New Belgrade Basketball Hall to be full and try to beat Turkey with new young forces, which will not be easy. We promise to leave the last atom of power in the field, in our well-known manner, to achieve victory, Maljkovic said.
One of Serbia's best basketball players, Sonja Petrovic, is recovering from injury but will be on the team against Turkey.
- As the coach pointed out, I think we have already started this new cycle at the European Junior Championships, because it gave some young girls the opportunity to be older than us. which gave us some new energy throughout the EP. I'm glad to be with the team during this "window" even though I won't be able to play because I'm in the recovery phase. I will do my best to be with the girls as much as we can from what is most important, which is the qualifying tournament for the Olympics in February. I hope we get a household ... Young players need to grow up with us. We are all aware that this generation may soon finish its story and we want it to be the right way - the Olympics and the eventual result in Tokyo. But the results are not all, we look at our legacy, what will be left after us. Although this match with Turkey is crucial in qualifying for the EP, it will be an opportunity to meet some new faces, to see how things work for us, Petrovic said.
The broader list includes Jelena Brooks, Aleksandra Stanacev, Maja Skoric, Jovana Nogic, Maja Miljkovic, Aleksandra Crvendakic, Nevena Jovanovic, Ana Dabovic, Nikolina Milic, Sasa Cadjo, Miljana Bojovic, Teodora Turudic, Snezana Bogicevic, Tina Krajovic, Tina Krajovic, Tina Krajovic Diana Butulija, Ivana Katanic, Sofia Olic, Aleksandra Muzevic, Masa Jankovic, Nadezda Nedeljkov, Milica Bojovic and Miona Zaric.
